String.Source: You're right. I heard the Raven of Anvil is a hideous, wart-covered crone.
String.Dest: 你说得对。我听铁砧城之鸦是一个丑陋的，混身瘊子的老太婆。

String.Source: (Laughs) And if I were the Raven, no doubt I would reveal myself to you and demand an apology.
String.Dest: (Laughs) And if I were the Raven, no doubt I would reveal myself to you and demand an apology.

String.Source: You're right. I heard the Raven of Anvil is a hideous, wart-covered crone.
String.Dest: 你说得对。我听铁砧城之鸦是一个丑陋的，混身瘊子的老太婆。

String.Source: But alas, I am not her, and take no offense to insults thrown at a stranger.
String.Dest: 唉，但我不是她，也无意去冒犯一个陌生人。

String.Source: You misunderstand me. I came here on behalf of your father.
String.Dest: 你误会我了，我是代你父亲来这儿的。

String.Source: Alas, my father and I are estranged, as he preferred I stay and help run the family business as opposed to traveling the world as a bard.
String.Dest: 可惜啊，我爸跟我早就疏远了，因为他想让我留下帮忙打理家族产业而不是做个吟游诗人旅行世界。

String.Source: You misunderstand me. I came here on behalf of your father.
String.Dest: 你误会我了，我是代你父亲来这儿的。

String.Source: If what you say is true, there is little doubt your message is more of the same.
String.Dest: 如果你说的是真的，大概你捎来的信也就是这么回事吧。

String.Source: Your father is going to hear about this. He will not be amused.
String.Dest: 你父亲会来听听这个。他不会被逗乐的。

String.Source: Hear about what, sera? All I hear is empty air.
String.Dest: Hear about what, sera? All I hear is empty air.

String.Source: I would like to hear the "Age of Aggression."
String.Dest: 我想听 "好战年代"。

String.Source: I...apologize, sera. I am new to Skyrim, and I am not familiar with that tune.
String.Dest: 我……对不起，先生。我刚来 天际省，还有点儿跟不上它的节奏。

String.Source: A traditional Nord song. "The Dragonborn Comes."
String.Dest: 诺德人的经典老歌： "龙裔归来"

String.Source: Ah, a fine request. I will be honored to sing this for you.
String.Dest: 啊，一个很好的请求。我很荣幸为你唱这首歌。

String.Source: Another bard. You singers are worse than fleas.
String.Dest: 换个吟游诗人。你们这些歌者还不如跳骚。

String.Source: (Laughs) I'd venture that's true. But how can you blame us? Mages are prestigious. Warriors are romantic. Only the bard lays claim to both.
String.Dest: (笑声)我想那可能是真的，不过这不怪我们，法师拥有名声，战士拥有浪漫。只有吟游诗人两者兼备。

String.Source: Another bard. You singers are worse than fleas.
String.Dest: 换个吟游诗人。你们这些歌者还不如跳骚。

String.Source: There are singers in every bathhouse, every campfire, every tavern.
String.Dest: 唱歌的人会出现在每一间浴场上，每一堆篝火旁，每一家旅店里。

String.Source: Another bard. You singers are worse than fleas.
String.Dest: 换个吟游诗人。你们这些歌者还不如跳骚。

String.Source: There are those who prefer to sing out loud and those who hum alone in a quiet room. For what is music but a cure for the day.
String.Dest: 有些人喜欢放声高歌，也有人喜欢在安静的房间独自哼唱。因为音乐是人们治愈自己一天辛劳的良药呢。

String.Source: The bard killed him.
String.Dest: 那个诗人把他杀了 。

String.Source: You asked for a tale about thieves, sera, not assassins. The mine owner, like most wealthy men, fancied wearing amulets and jewels.
String.Dest: You asked for a tale about thieves, sera, not assassins. The mine owner, like most wealthy men, fancied wearing amulets and jewels.

String.Source: The bard killed him.
String.Dest: 那个诗人把他杀了 。

String.Source: The thin red line was an imprint from an amulet, one set with a valuable jewel.
String.Dest: 这条细细的红印是一条护身符留下的，跟一枚贵重的宝石一套。

String.Source: The thin red line was an imprint from an amulet, one set with a valuable jewel.
String.Dest: 这细细的红线是一个护身符上的印记，和它一套的还有一枚珍贵的珠宝。

String.Source: The bard killed him.
String.Dest: 那个诗人把他杀了 。

String.Source: So valuable that the mine owner only saw fit to remove it from his safe on two occasions.
String.Dest: 贵重到那矿主只在两种情况下会把它拿出保险柜。

String.Source: So valuable that the mine owner only saw fit to remove it from his safe on two occasions.
String.Dest: 它是如此珍贵，以至于矿场主认为它只能在两种情况下离开他身边。

String.Source: The bard killed him.
String.Dest: 那个诗人把他杀了 。

String.Source: The day he wed his wife, and the day death made them part.
String.Dest: 在他与妻子为爱而结合的那一天，和因死亡而分离的那一日。

String.Source: As a person with deft hands, I admire how you work the strings.
String.Dest: 作为一个拥有灵巧的双手的人，我对你拨弄乐器的水平表示赞赏。

String.Source: Aren't you a clever one. And what strings would that be? The strings of a lute, the strings of a coin purse, or the strings of a fastened tunic?
String.Dest: 你难道不是个聪明人吗。那会是什么线呢？鲁特琴上的线，钱包上的线，还是系牢外衣的线呢？

String.Source: As a person with deft hands, I admire how you work the strings.
String.Dest: 作为一个拥有灵巧的双手的人，我对你拨弄乐器的水平表示赞赏。

String.Source: Some hands are deft with one and clumsy with another, whereas others are masters of all three.
String.Dest: Some hands are deft with one and clumsy with another, whereas others are masters of all three.

String.Source: As a person with deft hands, I admire how you work the strings.
String.Dest: 作为一个拥有灵巧的双手的人，我对你拨弄乐器的水平表示赞赏。

String.Source: Yet I am no thief. Why risk stealing coin, when I can just as easily play for it.
String.Dest: Yet I am no thief. Why risk stealing coin, when I can just as easily play for it.

String.Source: I put my armor on backwards once. Naturally, it started a new trend.
String.Dest: 有一次我把盔甲穿反了。自然而然，它就成了一种潮流。

String.Source: They do say that some of the greatest discoveries are born not from design, but accident.
String.Dest: 确实有人说有不少伟大的发现不是源自设计，而是因为错误。

String.Source: I put my armor on backwards once. Naturally, it started a new trend.
String.Dest: 有一次我把盔甲穿反了。自然而然，它就成了一种潮流。

String.Source: Although most accidents never reach such lofty heights.
String.Dest: 尽管大多数事故都从未达到如此崇高的境界.

String.Source: I would like to hear "The Tale of the Tongues."
String.Dest: 我想听一下 "龙语传说。"

String.Source: It will be my pleasure, sera.
String.Dest: 这是我的荣幸，大人。

String.Source: No one will take a piece of paper over the word of a hero. Guards! Guards!
String.Dest: 没人可以在一位英雄一声话后带走任何东西。守卫！守卫！

String.Source: (Laughs) I'm sorry, but you are not the first to accuse me of such.
String.Dest: (笑声) 抱歉，但你可不是第一个用这事儿控告我的人。

String.Source: No one will take a piece of paper over the word of a hero. Guards! Guards!
String.Dest: 没人可以在一位英雄一声话后带走任何东西。守卫！守卫！

String.Source: While I myself pay them no heed, the guards have grown quite weary of them. One poor man was even thrown into jail for a night.
String.Dest: 我没有注意到，现在卫兵们越来越不耐烦了。一个可怜的家伙甚至随随便便地就被关了一晚上。

String.Source: You can't help yourself. You want to get caught.
String.Dest: 你帮不了自己。你是就想被抓起来。

String.Source: Of course! That must be it. Dungeons are so lovely this time of year, and torture is forever sublime.
String.Dest: 真的哎！肯定是这样。每年这个时候的地牢是多么可爱啊，酷刑什么的永远是最棒的。

String.Source: I see. You want to use the same grift you used on the Countess of Anvil.
String.Dest: 明白了，你打算把对铁砧城女爵那种诡计照搬一次是吧。

String.Source: That is a heavy accusation, sera. Rumors are but ghosts, and it's best we don't pay them any heed.
String.Dest: 这可是个大罪名啊，大人。谣言都像幽灵一样，我们最好丝毫不相信它们才对。

String.Source: I see. You want to use the same grift you used on the Countess of Anvil.
String.Dest: 明白了，你打算把对铁砧城女爵那种诡计照搬一次是吧。

String.Source: But I'll allow it this one time, if you do as I ask. Take this letter to the guardsman.
String.Dest: 如果你像我要求的那样做了，这次我就忍了。把这个消息捎给那个卫兵。

String.Source: I see. You want to use the same grift you used on the Countess of Anvil.
String.Dest: 明白了，你打算把对铁砧城女爵那种诡计照搬一次是吧。

String.Source: When you have gained his trust, you will ask him a favor. To write my name on a ledger of famous bards. Nothing more.
String.Dest: 等你取得了他的信任，就让他帮个小忙。把我的名字写上天际着名诗人名单。就行啦。

String.Source: I see. You want to use the same grift you used on the Countess of Anvil.
String.Dest: 明白了，你打算把对铁砧城女爵那种诡计照搬一次是吧。

String.Source: As for your payment, I will give you half of it now. When my name is on that list, you'll receive the rest.
String.Dest: As for your payment, I will give you half of it now. When my name is on that list, you'll receive the rest.

String.Source: It's good to see that there are those in Skyrim who still speak with grace, and live with honor.
String.Dest: 很高兴看到天际还有您这样谈吐风雅，为荣耀而活的人。

String.Source: If your song is true, I will gladly spread news of your prowess.
String.Dest: 要是你的歌是真的，我会荣幸的四处宣传你的英勇。

String.Source: Not a chance. I came to this ugly rockpile of a hold because I want something, and I always get what I want.
String.Dest: 决不可能。我来到这恶心的石头城就是因为这有我要的东西。我想要什么就一定要得到。

String.Source: Well, we did all we could. It's time to give up this mad scheme.
String.Dest: 行了，我们已经尽力。是时候放弃这个疯狂的决定了。

String.Source: You still have an agreement to honor, and more gold to collect. And you will, as soon as we get a forger to alter this journal.
String.Dest: 你答应的约定仍然要实践，还有更多的金子要获得。你一定行，我们只要找到造假师来修改这个日志。

String.Source: Well, we did all we could. It's time to give up this mad scheme.
String.Dest: 行了，我们已经尽力。是时候放弃这个疯狂的决定了。

String.Source: I'll keep an eye out, but I have to keep up appearances. You don't. That's why I need you to find me someone, a contact anything.
String.Dest: 我会留意,但我不得不装门面。你不喜欢这样。这就是为什么我无论如何都需要你找一个我的人,作为我们之间的联系人。

String.Source: Well, we did all we could. It's time to give up this mad scheme.
String.Dest: 行了，我们已经尽力。是时候放弃这个疯狂的决定了。

String.Source: Hmm....there was an Elf here the other day, wearing fake college robes. He said he had a relative near Windhelm. See if you can find him.
String.Dest: 嗯。。。前几天这来了一个穿学院服的精灵。 他说他在风舵城附近有个亲戚. 看你能不能找到他.

String.Source: Well, we did all we could. It's time to give up this mad scheme.
String.Dest: 行了，我们已经尽力。是时候放弃这个疯狂的决定了。

String.Source: And hurry. It won't be long before the Jarl takes the whip to Yngvar and when he does, it's my name he has to sing.
String.Dest: 动作要快。领主恐怕很快就会拷问英瓦，到时候他就一定会吐出我的名字来。

String.Source: Well, we did all we could. It's time to give up this mad scheme.
String.Dest: 行了，我们已经尽力。是时候放弃这个疯狂的决定了。

String.Source: This isn't mining, you idiot, this is art. The best ones aren't necessarily the ones who get noticed.
String.Dest: 这不是在挖矿，你个蠢才，这是艺术。最好的艺术可未必都是有人关注的。

String.Source: The only sure way to get on that list is through sweat and hard work.
String.Dest: 唯有通过汗水及努力，才能解决这清单。

String.Source: Sometimes it's about who you know, and other times it's about who you're sleeping with. Rarely is it ever about how well you play.
String.Dest: 有时候取决于你认识谁，有时候是看你跟谁睡。总之很少有人在乎你的技艺到底有多好。

String.Source: The only sure way to get on that list is through sweat and hard work.
String.Dest: 唯有通过汗水及努力，才能解决这清单。

String.Source: No, what we need is a forger. Someone who can slide my name under the others and mimic this disgusting handwriting.
String.Dest: 不，我们需要的是一个造假师。一个能把我的名字塞进其他人的下面并且还要能模仿那种讨厌的字体的人。

String.Source: The only sure way to get on that list is through sweat and hard work.
String.Dest: 唯有通过汗水及努力，才能解决这清单。

String.Source: But where am I going to find a forger that isn't loyal to the Silver-Bloods?
String.Dest: 但我要去哪里找不效忠银血的造假师呢？

String.Source: The only sure way to get on that list is through sweat and hard work.
String.Dest: 唯有通过汗水及努力，才能解决这清单。

String.Source: Hmm....there was an Elf here the other day, wearing fake college robes. He said he had a relative near Windhelm. See if you can find him.
String.Dest: 嗯。。。前几天这来了一个穿学院服的精灵。 他说他在风舵城附近有个亲戚. 看你能不能找到他.

String.Source: The only sure way to get on that list is through sweat and hard work.
String.Dest: 唯有通过汗水及努力，才能解决这清单。

String.Source: Then you better get on the next boat to Black Marsh. Although I've got to hand it to the old man, I was surprised he got as close as he did.
String.Dest: 那么你最好马上乘坐下一班去往黑沼泽省的渡船. 虽然我已经把它交给了那位老头，但是出乎我的意料之外，他居然已经靠得如此近。

String.Source: And the Raven of Anvil reveals herself. Your father must be told.
String.Dest: 并且铁砧城的乌鸦暴露了自己。得告诉你父亲。

String.Source: But I have a friend with the Oculatus who gave him a few false leads. Right now he should be on a boat to the other side of the continent.
String.Dest: 但是我的一些锐眼鹰朋友给了他一些错误的情报。现在他坐船去大陆的另一端了。

String.Source: And the Raven of Anvil reveals herself. Your father must be told.
String.Dest: 并且铁砧城的乌鸦暴露了自己。得告诉你父亲。

String.Source: I could use a forger now. Someone with an expertise in handwriting. Hmm...there was an Elf here the other day, wearing fake college robes.
String.Dest: I could use a forger now. Someone with an expertise in handwriting. Hmm...there was an Elf here the other day, wearing fake college robes.

String.Source: And the Raven of Anvil reveals herself. Your father must be told.
String.Dest: 并且铁砧城的乌鸦暴露了自己。得告诉你父亲。

String.Source: He might have a contact or someone who can forge letters as well. He said he was going to follow the White River east to Windhelm.
String.Dest: 他或许有消息或者有其他的人也能伪造信件。他说他会顺着白河向东前往风舵城。

String.Source: And the Raven of Anvil reveals herself. Your father must be told.
String.Dest: 并且铁砧城的乌鸦暴露了自己。得告诉你父亲。

String.Source: But hurry, we can't hold onto this list forever. At some point the Jarl's going to request Yngvar bring him another bard.
String.Dest: 但是要快，我们无法保证名单上的名字不变。有消息说领主正要求英瓦带另一个吟游诗人过来。

String.Source: And the Raven of Anvil reveals herself. Your father must be told.
String.Dest: 并且铁砧城的乌鸦暴露了自己。得告诉你父亲。

String.Source: Save it. You know who I am, and I know who you are. The point is no one can prove either of us is a thief, so stop acting like you just got knighted.
String.Dest: 省省吧。你知道我是谁，我还知道你是什么人呢。关键在于谁也证明不了对方是个贼，所以就少拿自己当正义骑士吧。

String.Source: Aha! I knew you weren't some polite traveling bard.
String.Dest: 啊哈，就知道你不是那种正经的吟游诗人。

String.Source: I'm talking to you straight because we don't have time for pretenses.
String.Dest: 我跟你开门见山是因为现在没空装作客套了。

String.Source: Aha! I knew you weren't some polite traveling bard.
String.Dest: 啊哈，就知道你不是那种正经的吟游诗人。

String.Source: This has to be back in Yngvar's pocket before the next time he uses it to wipe the Jarl's ass.
String.Dest: 这东西得赶快送回英瓦的口袋，赶在他下次用这玩意儿给领主擦屁股之前。

String.Source: Aha! I knew you weren't some polite traveling bard.
String.Dest: 啊哈，就知道你不是那种正经的吟游诗人。

String.Source: But where am I going to find a forger that isn't loyal to the Silver-Bloods?
String.Dest: 但我要去哪里找不效忠银血的造假师呢？

String.Source: Aha! I knew you weren't some polite traveling bard.
String.Dest: 啊哈，就知道你不是那种正经的吟游诗人。

String.Source: Hmm....there was an Elf here the other day, wearing fake college robes. He said he had a relative near Windhelm. See if you can find him.
String.Dest: 嗯。。。前几天这来了一个穿学院服的精灵。 他说他在风舵城附近有个亲戚. 看你能不能找到他.

String.Source: Aha! I knew you weren't some polite traveling bard.
String.Dest: 啊哈，就知道你不是那种正经的吟游诗人。

String.Source: Oh my, sera, whatever do you mean?
String.Dest: 噢天哪，大人，您是啥意思啊？

String.Source: Wait, something about your tone has changed.
String.Dest: 等等你声调怎么变了.

String.Source: Is that what you were expecting? Well forget it. We don't have time for pretenses.
String.Dest: 你想要的是这个调调吗？算了吧。我们现在没空装模作样。

String.Source: Wait, something about your tone has changed.
String.Dest: 等等你声调怎么变了.

String.Source: This journal needs to be back in Yngvar's pocket before he tries to stroke himself and accidentally finds it missing.
String.Dest: 这本日记得还送回到英瓦的口袋中，不然等他自己一摸却突然发现日记不翼而飞可就麻烦了。

String.Source: Wait, something about your tone has changed.
String.Dest: 等等你声调怎么变了.

String.Source: But where am I going to find a forger that isn't loyal to the Silver-Bloods?
String.Dest: 但我要去哪里找不效忠银血的造假师呢？

String.Source: Wait, something about your tone has changed.
String.Dest: 等等你声调怎么变了.

String.Source: Hmm....there was an Elf here the other day, wearing fake college robes. He said he had a relative near Windhelm. See if you can find him.
String.Dest: 嗯。。。前几天这来了一个穿学院服的精灵。 他说他在风舵城附近有个亲戚. 看你能不能找到他.

String.Source: Wait, something about your tone has changed.
String.Dest: 等等你声调怎么变了.

String.Source: I suppose not. Although it's just as well. Look at this handwriting. It's so...flowery and ugh, it makes me want to vomit.
String.Dest: 我不那么认为，尽管这看起来也没什么特别的。看看这笔迹，这也...太潦草了吧，让我恶心得有点想吐。

String.Source: When you pick pockets, you can't just hover around and pull out a quill.
String.Dest: 当你掏别人的腰包的时候，你不能只是在旁边转悠然后掏出一根豪猪刺

String.Source: Which means you couldn't just write the name in. Damn college bards and their fancy script. This bloody fetcher must be completely full of himself.
String.Dest: 这意味着你不能只是简单地写名字。该死的学院诗人和他们花里胡哨的手稿。该死的邀请者肯定满脑子都是他自己。

String.Source: When you pick pockets, you can't just hover around and pull out a quill.
String.Dest: 当你掏别人的腰包的时候，你不能只是在旁边转悠然后掏出一根豪猪刺

String.Source: By Zenithar, you're right! This oaf isn't an oaf at hall. He writes like a pompous lord.
String.Dest: 泽尼萨尔在上啊，你是对的！这家伙根本不是傻蛋。他的字写得像有身份的领主。

String.Source: This list is written in his handwriting. I couldn't just write your name.
String.Dest: 这个清单上有着他的字迹我不能只写你的名字。

String.Source: You did the right thing to bring this back here. No way someone with his tongue this far down his own crotch wouldn't notice a change in flavor.
String.Dest: 你把这东西带回这儿来算是带对了。他这种敏感的艺人可不会忽略这样的字迹变化。

String.Source: This list is written in his handwriting. I couldn't just write your name.
String.Dest: 这个清单上有着他的字迹我不能只写你的名字。

String.Source: You may be right, but it was still foolish to take that chance. Wait, how much of a brute is the Singer?
String.Dest: 你当然有理，但冒这样的风险还是很愚蠢。等等，这个歌手到底有多牲畜？

String.Source: Yngvar is a brute with more fleas than brains. He'll think he misplaced it.
String.Dest: 英瓦是个虱子比脑子多的畜生。他老感觉自己把虱子和脑子放错位置了。

String.Source: He doesn't write like a brute...in fact, it's the other way around. His handwriting is so flowery it's practically illegible.
String.Dest: 不是说他像个疯子一样写东西…事实上，情况完全相反。他的笔迹是如此花哨以至于让人很难辨认出他写的是什么。

String.Source: Yngvar is a brute with more fleas than brains. He'll think he misplaced it.
String.Dest: 英瓦是个虱子比脑子多的畜生。他老感觉自己把虱子和脑子放错位置了。

String.Source: Which means you couldn't just write the name in. Damn college bards and their fancy script. This bloody fetcher must be completely full of himself.
String.Dest: 这意味着你不能只是简单地写名字。该死的学院诗人和他们花里胡哨的手稿。该死的邀请者肯定满脑子都是他自己。

String.Source: Yngvar is a brute with more fleas than brains. He'll think he misplaced it.
String.Dest: 英瓦是个虱子比脑子多的畜生。他老感觉自己把虱子和脑子放错位置了。

String.Source: She may. A bard hears many rumors on the road, some of which are quite valuable to those who work in the shadows.
String.Dest: 她会的。一个吟游诗人在路上会听到许多流言，而它们中的一些对于工作在阴影中的人很有价值。

String.Source: (Raven of Anvil) Would a bard know where a thief could find some work?
String.Dest: （铁砧城的瑞文）吟游诗人会知道一个贼该上哪找活做么？

String.Source: To the left of the entrance to Markarth, you will find a flight of stairs. Take one flight up, then one flight down.
String.Dest: 在马卡斯城入口左边，你会看到一段台阶。先往上爬一段，再往下走一段。

String.Source: (Raven of Anvil) Would a bard know where a thief could find some work?
String.Dest: （铁砧城的瑞文）吟游诗人会知道一个贼该上哪找活做么？

String.Source: There you will find a storeroom with a workbench, barrels, and a man. A guard by the name of Lundvar.
String.Dest: 在那里你会找到一个储藏室，那里有工作台和桶，以及一个叫兰发的守卫.

String.Source: (Raven of Anvil) Would a bard know where a thief could find some work?
String.Dest: （铁砧城的瑞文）吟游诗人会知道一个贼该上哪找活做么？

String.Source: Blood stains his eyes and mead frosts his breath. He is short for a Nord, yet nothing short of an honorable one.
String.Dest: 血色染上了他的眼眸，蜂蜜酒冻结了他的呼吸。他是一个矮小的诺德人，但没有什么能减少那份荣光。

String.Source: (Raven of Anvil) Would a bard know where a thief could find some work?
String.Dest: （铁砧城的瑞文）吟游诗人会知道一个贼该上哪找活做么？

String.Source: What he does not know is he has been betrayed. When you tell him this, his lips will be as loose as his throat is wet.
String.Dest: 他所不知道的是自己已经被人出卖了。当你告诉他这个消息，他肯定会惊得张大了嘴巴一句话也说不出来。

String.Source: (Raven of Anvil) Would a bard know where a thief could find some work?
String.Dest: （铁砧城的瑞文）吟游诗人会知道一个贼该上哪找活做么？

String.Source: He knows the location of a ledger. One that names the greatest bards in all of Skyrim. I would pay good coin to have my name atop it.
String.Dest: 他知道一个特殊账本的位置。那本记录着整个天际最伟大的吟游诗人名单的账本。我想花一笔钱请人把我的名字写上去。

String.Source: (Raven of Anvil) Would a bard know where a thief could find some work?
String.Dest: （铁砧城的瑞文）吟游诗人会知道一个贼该上哪找活做么？

String.Source: I see. Well, that was poor judgment on your part, if the Singer notices the list went missing, all my plans would be for naught.
String.Dest: 我明白了。不过你那种判断是靠不住的，要是【the Singer】注意到单子不见了，我的所有计划就全泡汤了。

String.Source: I talked to the guard, but I ended up having to steal your list.
String.Dest: 我和那个守卫说话，但结束时已经偷走了你的清单。

String.Source: An unusual request, to say the least. Are you by chance from The Gold Coast? Although it is not a well known tune, even there.
String.Dest: 不得不说，您这曲子点得不寻常啊。莫非您正巧是从黄金海岸来的？虽然就算在那儿这曲子也没那么出名。

String.Source: I would like to hear "Dusk on Anvil Harbor."
String.Dest: 我想听《铁砧港上的暮色》这首曲子。

String.Source: However, you're in luck. As I hail from Cyrodiil, I am well versed in songs of all varieties, and songs of melancholy are my specialty.
String.Dest: 不过，你很幸运。我来自赛瑞迪尔，精通所有歌曲,，而演奏悲伤的歌曲更是我的专长。

String.Source: I would like to hear "Dusk on Anvil Harbor."
String.Dest: 我想听《铁砧港上的暮色》这首曲子。

String.Source: You're in luck. As I hail from Cyrodiil, I am well versed in songs of all varieties, and songs of melancholy are my specialty.
String.Dest: 你真走运。我正好来自赛瑞迪尔，精通各种类型的歌曲，而忧郁风的曲子更是我的专长。

String.Source: All the songs in Skyrim are jovial. I want to hear a sad tune.
String.Dest: 天际里的所有歌都是愉快的。我想听一首悲伤的曲子。

String.Source: The mine owner sits on his gilded throne, mouth stuffed with pheasants and chin dripping with wine, when news comes by courier of death and tragedy.
String.Dest: 当那矿主坐在他的镀金宝座上，嘴里塞满了野鸡肉，下巴还淌着酒时，信使捎来了死亡的惨讯。

String.Source: Sounds like Cidhna Mine. What happens to the mine owner?
String.Dest: 听起来像是希讷矿坑。那个矿场主发生了什么事？

String.Source: His wife was killed in a horrible accident. She had slipped off a ledge and crushed her head on the stone below.
String.Dest: 他的妻子死于一场严重的事故。她从一块礁石滑下，把头撞在了下面的一块石头上。

String.Source: Sounds like Cidhna Mine. What happens to the mine owner?
String.Dest: 听起来像是希讷矿坑。那个矿场主发生了什么事？

String.Source: The funeral lasted all through the night, and the coffin laid to rest. Then the bard stood by the mine owner, and sung her solemn dirge.
String.Dest: 葬礼持续了一整夜，然后棺材被埋葬了。诗人站在矿坑主面前，吟唱着庄重的挽歌。

String.Source: Sounds like Cidhna Mine. What happens to the mine owner?
String.Dest: 听起来像是希讷矿坑。那个矿场主发生了什么事？

String.Source: Men wiped their eyes, and women fell in their arms. The mine owner, however, remained silent, with but a single red smile on his neck.
String.Dest: 男人们用力擦拭眼睛，女人们把头埋在臂弯里。而矿主没有发出任何声音，只有脖颈绽放出一抹殷红。

String.Source: Sounds like Cidhna Mine. What happens to the mine owner?
String.Dest: 听起来像是希讷矿坑。那个矿场主发生了什么事？

String.Source: I am a but a humble bard, and know nothing of either. Yet as a bard, I can craft you a tale.
String.Dest: 我不过是一个谦卑的吟游诗人，什么也不知道。然而，作为一名诗人，我可以创造你的故事。

String.Source: I want to hear a tale about thieves and nobles.
String.Dest: 我想知道关于盗贼和贵族的传言.

String.Source: This story begins in a Dwemer city, ruled not by kings, chieftains, or Jarls, but by the people, so that no mortal may rule over another.
String.Dest: 这个故事开始于一座锻莫城市，没有国王，或头领，或领主，而是由人民自己统治，所以凡人之间相互平等，没有阶级。

String.Source: I want to hear a tale about thieves and nobles.
String.Dest: 我想知道关于盗贼和贵族的传言.

String.Source: However, where there is no throne, a mine owner seeks to build one, smelted from ore wrought by slaves.
String.Dest: 然后，哪里没有宝座，矿主就让奴隶采矿熔炼设法建。

String.Source: I want to hear a tale about thieves and nobles.
String.Dest: 我想知道关于盗贼和贵族的传言.

String.Source: Slaves to debt, and slaves to a mistake, as there is no abolition for criminals and the poor.
String.Dest: 欠了债的就来做奴隶，犯了错的也划为奴隶，因为罪犯和穷人是不会消失的。

String.Source: I want to hear a tale about thieves and nobles.
String.Dest: 我想知道关于盗贼和贵族的传言.

String.Source: It is well known that the Raven of Anvil was born on the darkest month of The Evening Star, under the birthsign of The Thief.
String.Dest: 众所周知，the Raven of Anvi出生在夜星最暗的那一月，星座盗贼之石。

String.Source: How does the certificate prove your innocence?
String.Dest: 证据是如何证明你的清白？

String.Source: And while we are not the same woman, I must admit I have used her infamy to my advantage, both as a bard and a lady.
String.Dest: 而且虽然我和她不是同一个人，我必须承认自己利用她的恶名占了些便宜，包括吟游诗人和一个女人的身份。

String.Source: How does the certificate prove your innocence?
String.Dest: 证据是如何证明你的清白？

String.Source: As you should, for I already gave you my name and my vocation.
String.Dest: 理所当然哪，我的姓名职业早都告诉你了呀。

String.Source: Enough with the games. I know who you are.
String.Dest: 不要再玩了，我知道你是谁。

String.Source: If you mean to insinuate that I am a certain raven-haired thief, then you will not be the first. We do share a number of similar traits.
String.Dest: If you mean to insinuate that I am a certain raven-haired thief, then you will not be the first. We do share a number of similar traits.

String.Source: Enough with the games. I know who you are.
String.Dest: 不要再玩了，我知道你是谁。

String.Source: For that reason I keep the certificate of birth on my person. It states that I was born Asteria of Bravil, under the birth sign of the ritual.
String.Dest: 也就是这个原因我还随身携带了出生证明。它记载了我是出生于布拉威尔的阿斯特里亚，生辰标志是仪式星座。

String.Source: Enough with the games. I know who you are.
String.Dest: 不要再玩了，我知道你是谁。

String.Source: You are not the first, and I trust you won't be the last. There's no need to apologize. You were merely doing your duty as a citizen of the Empire.
String.Dest: 你不是第一个，我相信你也不会是最后一个。 没什么可道歉的。你只不过是尽了一位帝国公民应有的义务罢了。

String.Source: My apologies. A misunderstanding on my part.
String.Dest: 实在抱歉！这完全是我的误会！

String.Source: Drop my lute and fetch your ale, is it? I'm sorry, sera, but I'm not so easily dissuaded.
String.Dest: 放下我的鲁特琴然后拿你的啤酒，是吗？抱歉，先生，但我不会那么轻易的被说服。

String.Source: Give it up girl. This inn needs a tavern wench, not more noise.
String.Dest: 停下吧小姑娘，这店里需要的是女服务生，不是噪音。

String.Source: There are many of us who do indeed trade lutes for flagons and drums for cabbages.
String.Dest: 我们中有很多人确实能做出以琴换酒，卖鼓买菜这档子事儿。

String.Source: Give it up girl. This inn needs a tavern wench, not more noise.
String.Dest: 停下吧小姑娘，这店里需要的是女服务生，不是噪音。

String.Source: For every milkmaid and every farmer was once a bard to be, praying to the Divines that "someday" will be someday soon.
String.Dest: For every milkmaid and every farmer was once a bard to be, praying to the Divines that "someday" will be someday soon.

String.Source: Give it up girl. This inn needs a tavern wench, not more noise.
String.Dest: 停下吧小姑娘，这店里需要的是女服务生，不是噪音。

String.Source: Yet the lute still remains in my hand, and my grip is tighter than a knot of canis root.
String.Dest: Yet the lute still remains in my hand, and my grip is tighter than a knot of canis root.

String.Source: Give it up girl. This inn needs a tavern wench, not more noise.
String.Dest: 停下吧小姑娘，这店里需要的是女服务生，不是噪音。

String.Source: No, I suppose I didn't.
String.Dest: 不。我认为我没有。

String.Source: You didn't answer my question.
String.Dest: 你还没有回答我??的问题。

String.Source: That would be a mistake, sera. A bard can tell a thousand tales, each more fascinating than the last, but her own life is not one of them.
String.Dest: 这恐怕不太好啊，先生。做吟游诗人的能讲出成千上万的故事，一个比一个精彩，但是她自己的生活可不包括在内啊。

String.Source: I want to know more about you.
String.Dest: 我想了解你

String.Source: I hail from Cyrodiil, but I've plied my trade in Hammerfell and High Rock, and have tales to tell from each.
String.Dest: 我来自赛瑞迪尔，但我在落锤省和高岩省做生意，而且我在两处都有不少故事可说。

String.Source: You mentioned playing in other provinces.
String.Dest: 看来你周游过各省。

String.Source: It's as I told you. He's a murderer. There really isn't much more I care to say.
String.Dest: 我都说了，他是个杀人犯。别的我就真没什么可说的了。

String.Source: What about your father? What are your real feelings about him?
String.Dest: 那你父亲呢？你对他的真实感受如何？

String.Source: You are very astute, sera. Most would be quick to say the bard slit the mine owner's throat, when a thief is not in the business of murder.
String.Dest: 你还真是聪明呢，阁下。大多数人的第一反应都以为诗人割破了矿主的喉咙，也不想想做贼的干的可不是杀人的行当。

String.Source: A red mark on one's neck can mean any number of things.
String.Dest: 在一个人脖子上的红色标记可以表示一切。

String.Source: The thin red line was an imprint from an amulet, one set with a valuable jewel.
String.Dest: 这条细细的红印是一条护身符留下的，跟一枚贵重的宝石一套。

String.Source: The thin red line was an imprint from an amulet, one set with a valuable jewel.
String.Dest: 这细细的红线是一个护身符上的印记，和它一套的还有一枚珍贵的珠宝。

String.Source: A red mark on one's neck can mean any number of things.
String.Dest: 在一个人脖子上的红色标记可以表示一切。

String.Source: So valuable that the mine owner only saw fit to remove it from his safe on two occasions.
String.Dest: 贵重到那矿主只在两种情况下会把它拿出保险柜。

String.Source: So valuable that the mine owner only saw fit to remove it from his safe on two occasions.
String.Dest: 它是如此珍贵，以至于矿场主认为它只能在两种情况下离开他身边。

String.Source: A red mark on one's neck can mean any number of things.
String.Dest: 在一个人脖子上的红色标记可以表示一切。

String.Source: The day of he wed his wife, and the day death made them part.
String.Dest: 一是他和妻子因爱而结合的那天，二是死亡将他们分离的那天。

String.Source: A red mark on one's neck can mean any number of things.
String.Dest: 在一个人脖子上的红色标记可以表示一切。

String.Source: It is just as well sera, as I have no more to say. This letter, when handed to the guardsman, will speak louder than the both of us.
String.Dest: 幸好如此，先生，我什么都不用多说。把这封信交给守卫，会比我们俩空口白话更有说服力。

String.Source: Say no more.
String.Dest: 不要再说了。

String.Source: When you have gained his trust, you will ask him a favor. To write my name on a ledger of famous bards. Nothing more.
String.Dest: 等你取得了他的信任，就让他帮个小忙。把我的名字写上天际着名诗人名单。就行啦。

String.Source: Say no more.
String.Dest: 不要再说了。

String.Source: As for your payment, I will give you half of it now. When my name is on that list, you'll receive the rest.
String.Dest: As for your payment, I will give you half of it now. When my name is on that list, you'll receive the rest.

String.Source: Say no more.
String.Dest: 不要再说了。

String.Source: Of course, sera. It was impolite for me to ask.
String.Dest: 当然，先生. 对我而言，去问的话好像不太礼貌。

String.Source: Perhaps another time.
String.Dest: 下次再说吧。

String.Source: You could do that, but I'd be just as likely to admit I was Emperor Titus Mede II if that's what you wanted to believe.
String.Dest: 你尽管来啊，但我可能承认我是提图斯·迈德皇帝二世，只要你信的话。

String.Source: Why not tell the truth before I beat you bloody?
String.Dest: 何不实话实说免得有人挂彩呢？

String.Source: (Laughs) And you believed such a claim? The song is difficult, but by no means magic. It has a melody and a rhythm like any other.
String.Dest: (笑声) 你相信这么一份声明？歌曲很复杂， 但魔法不一样。它就像别的东西一样有自己的节奏和旋律。

String.Source: I was told only one woman is capable of playing that song.
String.Dest: 有人告诉我只有一个女人能够弹唱那首歌。

String.Source: It's the very same. From whom, may I ask, did you hear the tale?
String.Dest: It's the very same. From whom, may I ask, did you hear the tale?

String.Source: So that's the song that appeased the Countess of Anvil.
String.Dest: 所以，就是这首歌安抚了铁砧城女爵。

String.Source: I've played in provinces and castles across Tamriel, but I've yet to perform in front of a Jarl.
String.Dest: 我曾在整个塔姆瑞尔大陆的无数城堡演出过，但至今还没有演给一个领主听过。

String.Source: Do you have any experience?
String.Dest: 你有什么经验吗？

String.Source: As Skyrim was home to many renowned bards of legend, it is my hope that I may walk in their footsteps and pay tribute to their memory.
String.Dest: 因为天际省是许多传奇诗人的故乡，我希望我能重温他们的足迹并向他们的回忆致敬。

String.Source: Do you have any experience?
String.Dest: 你有什么经验吗？

String.Source: Do you mean, did it rain 7 days and 7 nights after I played? Gods no.
String.Dest: 你是说，在我演奏完后有没有下了七天七夜的雨？怎么可能。

String.Source: One last question. Is the story about the Countess of Anvil true?
String.Dest: 最后一个问题，关于铁砧城女爵的故事是真的吗？

String.Source: The rest of it went pretty much as they say. When the Countess was appeased, the court fell asleep in their exhaustion.
String.Dest: 其余的跟他们所说的差不多。当伯爵夫人终于被安抚了，宫廷的人都带着疲惫慢慢睡着了。

String.Source: One last question. Is the story about the Countess of Anvil true?
String.Dest: 最后一个问题，关于铁砧城女爵的故事是真的吗？

String.Source: Who could blame them? The poor woman had kept them up for nearly a fortnight.
String.Dest: 谁又能责怪他们呢？那可怜女人已经害他们两星期没睡觉了。

String.Source: One last question. Is the story about the Countess of Anvil true?
String.Dest: 最后一个问题，关于铁砧城女爵的故事是真的吗？

String.Source: As to why she favored my song, I don't know. There were bards with better voices, and bards who could play far more deftly than I.
String.Dest: 至于她为什么听得进我的歌，也不好说。有很多诗人的嗓子比我好，还有很多演奏比我强。

String.Source: One last question. Is the story about the Countess of Anvil true?
String.Dest: 最后一个问题，关于铁砧城女爵的故事是真的吗？

String.Source: But I guess the Countess wasn't interested in any of that. All she wanted was a bard who understood her grief.
String.Dest: 不过我觉得女爵对此不会有任何兴趣。她所想要的只是一个能理解她的哀愁的吟游诗人。

String.Source: One last question. Is the story about the Countess of Anvil true?
String.Dest: 最后一个问题，关于铁砧城女爵的故事是真的吗？

String.Source: Now, that's enough talk. We'll meet back at Old Hroldan when it's all done. Get some rest. Tomorrow's a big day.
String.Dest: 好了，我们说的够多了，完事儿后我们在古赫洛登碰面。去好好休息一下，明天可是个大日子。

String.Source: One last question. Is the story about the Countess of Anvil true?
String.Dest: 最后一个问题，关于铁砧城女爵的故事是真的吗？

String.Source: As many as it takes. When I see you enter the keep, I'll play "Mogo's Mead." That will be the signal that the next song is "Dusk on Anvil Harbor."
String.Dest: As many as it takes. When I see you enter the keep, I'll play "Mogo's Mead." That will be the signal that the next song is "Dusk on Anvil Harbor."

String.Source: How many songs do you plan on playing?
String.Dest: 你打算演奏多少首曲子？

String.Source: I always set up the sad tunes by playing that one first. It gets everybody up before I send them crashing down.
String.Dest: 在演奏忧伤的曲调之前我都要以这首曲子作为开头，它能让每个人先进入活跃气氛后再突然被抛入哀伤。

String.Source: How many songs do you plan on playing?
String.Dest: 你打算演奏多少首曲子？

String.Source: Here, I've made myself mostly invisible. In the keep, the two of us will stand out like a wart on a Countess' nose.
String.Dest: 给你吧，我几乎是把自己隐形了。在那堡垒里，我们两个的出现会像女伯爵鼻子上的疣一样显眼。

String.Source: Is it wise for us to be seen together?
String.Dest: 我们一起出现合适吗？

String.Source: That's why I'm getting an early start tomorrow. You shouldn't arrive until I get to the end of my set. That's when I'll draw the mercs.
String.Dest: 这就是为什么我得明天一大早就动身。你可别在我安排好一切之前出现啊。一定要等我把那些佣兵都引走之后。。

String.Source: Is it wise for us to be seen together?
String.Dest: 我们一起出现合适吗？

String.Source: What do you want, a map? Look, it's not exactly the Dwemer Museum. You'll have enough time to find it.
String.Dest: 你还想要啥，地图吗？拜托，那小地方又不是锻莫博物馆。你会有足够的时间自己找到的。

String.Source: Where in the Jarl's chamber is this safe?
String.Dest: 领主的长屋里有这么安全吗？

String.Source: It's not worth a bloody septim to anyone but me. So you'd be a horker's ass if you kept it for yourself.
String.Dest: 那玩意除我之外对别人来说连他妈一个赛普汀都不值。所以说你还想自己留着的话真是笨得跟海象一样了。

String.Source: What exactly is in this document?
String.Dest: 这文献里到底写了什么？

String.Source: Yeah, I'm sure it's important for a growing boy like the Jarl. I'm just not sure why he has to drink it straight from his mother's breast.
String.Dest: 是啊。我知道对领主这样成长中的孩子而言这事非常重要。我只是不懂他为什么非得直接从他妈妈的胸口去喝。

String.Source: Milk is good for your health and we shouldn't disparage people who drink it.
String.Dest: 牛奶有益于健康所以你不该鄙视那些喝牛奶的人。

String.Source: Anyway, we need to discuss the plan for the heist. Meet me at the Silver-Blood Inn.
String.Dest: 无论如何，抢劫的事我们需要讨论一下计划，到银血酒馆找我。

String.Source: Milk is good for your health and we shouldn't disparage people who drink it.
String.Dest: 牛奶有益于健康所以你不该鄙视那些喝牛奶的人。

String.Source: I'm sure you're eager to find out exactly what we'll be stealing from this privileged little fetcher.
String.Dest: 我肯定你是急着知道我们到底要从这个特使身上偷什么。

String.Source: Milk is good for your health and we shouldn't disparage people who drink it.
String.Dest: 牛奶有益于健康所以你不该鄙视那些喝牛奶的人。

String.Source: Naturally, and I'm sure the question has crossed your mind as well. Exactly what does this fetcher have that's so valuable?
String.Dest: 而且我确定那些问题已经很自然的汇入你的大脑。究竟是什么让这取物者看的如此珍贵？

String.Source: We'll see how privileged he acts after we've robbed him blind.
String.Dest: 我们会看到他表现得多么有特权，在我们随便地抢了他之后。

String.Source: We'll discuss that and a few other things later. Head on over to the Silver-Blood inn and check out a room. I'll meet you there.
String.Dest: 咱们稍后碰头把这个和其他事情一起商量下。你先去银血旅店开个房间。我到了那就去找你。

String.Source: We'll see how privileged he acts after we've robbed him blind.
String.Dest: 我们会看到他表现得多么有特权，在我们随便地抢了他之后。

String.Source: Yeah, but it's his fault for staying that way. In any case, meet me at the Silver-Blood Inn. We need to discuss our plans.
String.Dest: Yeah, but it's his fault for staying that way. In any case, meet me at the Silver-Blood Inn. We need to discuss our plans.

String.Source: It's not the Jarl's fault he was born privileged.
String.Dest: 出身于特权阶级这一点又不是领主的错。

String.Source: I'm sure you're eager to find out exactly what we'll be stealing from this privileged little fetcher.
String.Dest: 我肯定你是急着知道我们到底要从这个特使身上偷什么。

String.Source: It's not the Jarl's fault he was born privileged.
String.Dest: 出身于特权阶级这一点又不是领主的错。

String.Source: Good. We better head on over to Markarth then. If we're lucky, we'll catch him on the way.
String.Dest: 很好。我们最好赶快到马卡斯城。如果我们运气好的话，说不定能在半路上就遇到他。

String.Source: It wasn't easy, but I expect the courier to come by soon with your summons.
String.Dest: 这不容易，不过我还是希望那个送货的能在你召唤了之后立刻前来。

String.Source: Good. We better head on over to Markarth then. If we're lucky, we'll catch him on the way.
String.Dest: 很好。我们最好赶快到马卡斯城。如果我们运气好的话，说不定能在半路上就遇到他。

String.Source: Fear not. The Singer will call your name.
String.Dest: 别怕，那个诗人会叫你名字的。

String.Source: Stop thinking like a troll with its head up its ass. The whole point of me playing is to draw them out of the room.
String.Dest: 别像巨魔一样顾头不顾腚地想问题。整件事的要点在于我用演奏把他们引出房间。

String.Source: Great. With mercs, I can stop all this sneaking around and just kill them.
String.Dest: 太好了。有了佣兵，我可以停止这偷偷摸摸的一切，只是杀了他们。

String.Source: The whole point of us not killing anyone is so no one can prove we were there.
String.Dest: 这件事的核心要素是我们不可以杀任何人从而没人能证明我们在场。

String.Source: Great. With mercs, I can stop all this sneaking around and just kill them.
String.Dest: 太好了。有了佣兵，我可以停止这偷偷摸摸的一切，只是杀了他们。

String.Source: What about your end? I trust you were able to handle things?
String.Dest: 你那边呢？我能相信你能搞定的吧？

String.Source: Great. With mercs, I can stop all this sneaking around and just kill them.
String.Dest: 太好了。有了佣兵，我可以停止这偷偷摸摸的一切，只是杀了他们。

String.Source: No, I'll play it, and it'll be all the more proof to those piss-drinkers I'm not the Raven of Anvil. They won't realize I have an accomplice.
String.Dest: No, I'll play it, and it'll be all the more proof to those piss-drinkers I'm not the Raven of Anvil. They won't realize I have an accomplice.

String.Source: If so, they'll know your strategy. You probably can't play that song either.
String.Dest: 如果那样，他们将会明了你的策略，你可能也无法演奏那首曲子了。

String.Source: What about your end? I trust you were able to handle things?
String.Dest: 你那边呢？我能相信你能搞定的吧？

String.Source: If so, they'll know your strategy. You probably can't play that song either.
String.Dest: 如果那样，他们将会明了你的策略，你可能也无法演奏那首曲子了。

String.Source: Not if I do my job they won't. Only I'm not sure if I should change the program. Those knuckle draggers would probably want to hear more drums.
String.Dest: 【如果我干了自己的活儿，他们就不会那样了。】我唯一不确定的是要不要改变计划。那些智障可能是想听到更多的鼓声。

String.Source: A few mercs won't get in our way.
String.Dest: 几个佣兵并不能阻挡我们。

String.Source: What about your end? I trust you were able to handle things?
String.Dest: 你那边呢？我能相信你能搞定的吧？

String.Source: A few mercs won't get in our way.
String.Dest: 几个佣兵并不能阻挡我们。

String.Source: I don't know. Either way, there's more security around the fetcher's safe than I anticipated.
String.Dest: 我不知道。但不管怎么说，这亡灵巫师的宝箱所受防卫之严真是超乎我的想象。

String.Source: Does the guard upheaval have something to do with Lundvar?
String.Dest: 守卫的混乱能对兰发产生影响吗？

String.Source: What about your end? I trust you were able to handle things?
String.Dest: 你那边呢？我能相信你能搞定的吧？

String.Source: Does the guard upheaval have something to do with Lundvar?
String.Dest: 守卫的混乱能对兰发产生影响吗？

String.Source: Tidings, sera. My name is Asteria, a traveling bard on her way to Markarth. If you would like to hear a song, do not hesitate to make a request.
String.Dest: 你好啊，先生。我叫阿斯特里亚，是个在往马卡斯城旅行路上的吟游诗人。如果你想听哪首歌，就不要犹豫的直说吧。

String.Source: I require no coin or patronage for my services. All I ask in return is the following favor.
String.Dest: 不用为我的服务而付钱或者资助。我所要求的的全部回报只是下一次的恩惠。

String.Source: Should my verse please you, then I would be gracious if you spread word of my song to the citizens of The Reach.
String.Dest: 如果我的诗词打动了你，我会非常感激如果你把传到Reach市民的耳中.

String.Source: Alright, I did some scouting, and it seems there's a bit of an upheaval with the guard.
String.Dest: 好吧，我确实进行过调查，那里的守卫似乎发生了一点骚乱。

String.Source: The Jarl doesn't seem to trust all of them, or any of them for that matter. He's hired a bunch of sellswords to guard his chamber.
String.Dest: 看来领主不是相信他们所有人，甚至根本一个都不相信。他单独雇了一群佣兵守卫自己的房间。

String.Source: It also doesn't help that before he left, my bastard father sent letters to all the stewards, warning them about a possible theft.
String.Dest: 那也没用，因为我的混蛋父亲在离开之前写信给所有的管家，警告过他们近期发生盗窃的可能性。

String.Source: [Realistic Room Rental Workaround - Still may run into a conflict at Silver-Blood Inn]
String.Dest: [租赁房间解决方案 - 银血旅馆还是存在发生冲突的可能]

String.Source: This is it, a summons from the Jarl. It says I've been granted "the privilege of playing before him."
String.Dest: 果然来了，领主发出的邀请函。说我已经获得了“当面为他演奏的特权”

String.Source: This snowback has the nerve to call me privileged? I can just picture the milk dribbling from his chin.
String.Dest: 这个snowback竟敢把我叫做享有特权的家伙?我几乎可以想象牛奶顺着他的下巴流下去的样子了。

String.Source: Well, I guess you're wondering what this is all about.
String.Dest: 好吧，我猜你也想知道这一切到底是为了什么。

String.Source: First, the prize. There's a safe filled with jewels in the Jarl's bed chamber. That's all yours. Consider it the second half of my payment.
String.Dest: 首先，报酬。在领主卧室里有一个被宝石塞满的保险柜。想想吧，就算那全都是你的，也不过是我给你报酬的一半。

String.Source: But what I need is the document that's underneath.
String.Dest: But what I need is the document that's underneath.

String.Source: I'll provide the distraction. The court will be easy enough. Just a bunch of haughty nobles with ice spikes so far up their ass they piss snow.
String.Dest: 我帮你分散他们的注意力。那些幕僚根本不需担心，只不过是一群屁股里带冰锥撒尿都有雪花的傲慢贵族。

String.Source: The mercs though, they might not leave until the finale.
String.Dest: 至于那些雇佣兵，他们在最后的演出之后才能离开。

String.Source: But given the fame of the Raven of Anvil, when I play "Dusk on Anvil Harbor," they'll all come. They always do.
String.Dest: 但鉴于铁砧城之鸦的名号，我一演奏“暮色铁砧港”，他们准来。他们一贯如此。

String.Source: All you need to do is pick the lock before I finish my set. Take too long, and you'll have to fight your way out.
String.Dest: 你要做的就是在我的表演完成之前解开那把锁. 拖太久的话，你就只能自己打出去了。

String.Source: Now, the most important thing. Don't be late. You should arrive at 3 o'clock but no later than five. I'll time my performance to your arrival.
String.Dest: 还有，最重要的是：别迟到。你要在3点钟到达，最迟不超过5点。我会为等你而掌握演出时间。

String.Source: What are you doing? We shouldn't be seen together.
String.Dest: 你在干什么？不能让别人看见我们在一起。

String.Source: How so?
String.Dest: 怎么会？

String.Source: A sword-maiden, for instance, could not profess her skill in battle then show up to the arena with her armor on backwards.
String.Dest: 比如一个女剑客不能在自称她很能打的同时却反穿着盔甲出现在竞技场。

String.Source: How so?
String.Dest: 怎么会？

String.Source: Nor can I claim to be a bard if my lute collects more dust than coin.
String.Dest: 倘若我的鲁特琴上的灰尘比硬币还多，我又怎敢自称为游吟诗人。

String.Source: How so?
String.Dest: 怎么会？

String.Source: Even here in Old Hroldan, there's always someone with a story. A lost loved one. A new job. A family reunion. A long goodbye.
String.Dest: 就算是在这老霍尔丹，也总有人带着故事。一个失去的爱人。一份新的工作。一个家庭的重聚。一场漫长的别离。

String.Source: How so?
String.Dest: 怎么会？

String.Source: And whether it's good, bad, or sad, a story always needs a tune.
String.Dest: 不论是好事，坏事，伤心事，每个故事都需要一支背景音乐。

String.Source: Not at the Bard's College, if that's what you're implying. I'm very much a bard, however, or I wouldn't advertise my services as such.
String.Dest: 如果你指吟游诗人学院，那我会说不是那里。我是位优秀的吟游诗人，否则我也不会如此昭告我的能力。

String.Source: Where have you trained?
String.Dest: 你在哪里训练的？

String.Source: If my skill were lacking, you would discover that soon enough.
String.Dest: 要是我的技法有什么不足，谁也都能马上发现的。

String.Source: Where have you trained?
String.Dest: 你在哪里训练的？

String.Source: Everything I told you was true. I would have never lasted this long if it wasn't.
String.Dest: 我所叙述给你听的没有半句谎言。如果这里面掺了假的话我也不会记得那么清楚了。

String.Source: What you said before, the stories, the hints about your past, was it all an act?
String.Dest: 难道你说过的关于你的过去的那些经历全部都是假的么?

String.Source: Think of it this way. You can dress a beggar in fine furs and drape amulets around his neck.
String.Dest: 你可以这样想。你能够让一个乞丐穿上鲜亮的毛皮，在他的脖子上戴上项链。

String.Source: What you said before, the stories, the hints about your past, was it all an act?
String.Dest: 难道你说过的关于你的过去的那些经历全部都是假的么?

String.Source: But as soon as the stupid fetcher opens his mouth, he'd be completely undressed.
String.Dest: But as soon as the stupid fetcher opens his mouth, he'd be completely undressed.

String.Source: What you said before, the stories, the hints about your past, was it all an act?
String.Dest: 难道你说过的关于你的过去的那些经历全部都是假的么?

String.Source: That's what a lie is. Layers upon layers that can all fall apart with a single truth. So I don't lie. I tell it to you straight.
String.Dest: 这就是谎言的意味。一层又一层的谎言土崩瓦解，最终流露出真相。所以我不说谎。我会直接明了的告诉你。

String.Source: What you said before, the stories, the hints about your past, was it all an act?
String.Dest: 难道你说过的关于你的过去的那些经历全部都是假的么?

String.Source: Only I dress my words in the bard's tongue...so that you, sera, will find the kindness to grant favor to my cause, even if you know not what I seek.
String.Dest: 只不过我是以吟游诗人的身份说出的那些话……所以, 先生, 你会找到善意赐福于我的原因，即使你不知道我在寻求什么。

String.Source: What you said before, the stories, the hints about your past, was it all an act?
String.Dest: 难道你说过的关于你的过去的那些经历全部都是假的么?

String.Source: A Warrior's Life.
String.Dest: 《战士的一生》

String.Source: It will be my pleasure, sera.
String.Dest: 这是我的荣幸，大人。

String.Source: With Bells On.
String.Dest: 【准备玩儿个痛快吧。/痛快挥洒（歌名）】

String.Source: It will be my pleasure, sera.
String.Dest: 这是我的荣幸，大人。

String.Source: Eyldi the Bear.
String.Dest: 狗熊艾迪。

String.Source: Ah, a fine request. I would be honored to sing this for you.
String.Dest: 啊，选得不错。很荣幸为您演唱这首歌。

String.Source: Can you play "Tears of the Hist?"
String.Dest: 你能演奏 "希斯之泪?"

String.Source: You're in luck. Songs of melancholy are my specialty.
String.Dest: 你真走运，忧郁风是我最擅长的了。

String.Source: I want to hear the "Wolves of Jorrvaskr."
String.Dest: 我想听听这“月瓦斯卡群狼”。

String.Source: Ah, a fine request. I would be honored to sing this for you.
String.Dest: 啊，选得不错。很荣幸为您演唱这首歌。

String.Source: Can you play "Mogo's Mead?"
String.Dest: 你能演奏"莫格蜜酒"吗？

String.Source: It will be my pleasure, sera.
String.Dest: 这是我的荣幸，大人。

String.Source: I'd like to make a request.
String.Dest: 我想要点歌。

String.Source: Of course, sera. We must do our best to keep up appearances.
String.Dest: 当然啦，大人。咱们这表面功夫还是得做足是吧。

String.Source: I'd like to make a request.
String.Dest: 我想要点歌。

String.Source: As you wish. What would you like me to play?
String.Dest: 如你所愿。你想听我弹奏什么？

String.Source: I'd like to make a request.
String.Dest: 我想要点歌。

String.Source: I'm afraid I just sat down sera. Ask me again when I'm not.
String.Dest: 我才刚坐下想歇会儿的啊大人。等我有力气的时候再说吧。

String.Source: What do you mean, he turned a "blind eye to morality?"
String.Dest: 你这话什么意思？他成为道德视而不见的人？

String.Source: I will leave you with one last story. There once was a loyal and dedicated soldier who held beside him a great, big shield.
String.Dest: 我给你讲最后一个故事。从前有一位英勇尽职的战士时刻手持一面厚重的巨盾。

String.Source: What do you mean, he turned a "blind eye to morality?"
String.Dest: 你这话什么意思？他成为道德视而不见的人？

String.Source: For king and country he raised it high, shielding himself from arrow and sword.
String.Dest: 为了国家和君主他将它高举，使他免于刀箭之虞。

String.Source: What do you mean, he turned a "blind eye to morality?"
String.Dest: 你这话什么意思？他成为道德视而不见的人？

String.Source: And when his king razed the land and raped its people, he used it to shield his eyes. But his wife would not turn her cheek, or avert her gaze.
String.Dest: 而当他的君主践踏着江山，掠夺着人民之时，他却用那巨盾遮住自己的眼睛。而他的妻子却不肯转过头去，甚至连目光都没有躲闪。

String.Source: What do you mean, he turned a "blind eye to morality?"
String.Dest: 你这话什么意思？他成为道德视而不见的人？

String.Source: The price she paid was death, one she paid herself, her only legacy a song.
String.Dest: The price she paid was death, one she paid herself, her only legacy a song.

String.Source: Yes, your father is an Imperial agent. But he just wants to see you.
String.Dest: 是的，你父亲是帝国的特工。但是他现在只是想见见你。

String.Source: (Sigh) The Penitus Oculatus are a crafty lot indeed.
String.Dest: （叹）那些锐眼鹰的人真是狡猾得多了。

String.Source: Yes, your father is an Imperial agent. But he just wants to see you.
String.Dest: 是的，你父亲是帝国的特工。但是他现在只是想见见你。

String.Source: If one were say, a master thief, she could not have avoided them for this long by falling for such maudlin drivel.
String.Dest: 有人曾说过，堂堂盗贼大师，她不可能就因为沉溺于那些伤感的废话而避开他们那么久。

String.Source: Yes, your father is an Imperial agent. But he just wants to see you.
String.Dest: 是的，你父亲是帝国的特工。但是他现在只是想见见你。

String.Source: Some mortals see only what they wish to see, for to cast their eyes upon the truth is to question all that they believe in, or all they stand for.
String.Dest: 某些凡人只看见他们所想看见的，只有质疑所有他们所相信的东西以及他们的立场才能让他们重新审视真相。

String.Source: Yes, your father is an Imperial agent. But he just wants to see you.
String.Dest: 是的，你父亲是帝国的特工。但是他现在只是想见见你。

String.Source: The agent turns a blind eye to morality. His tool turns a blind eye to the agent's true intentions. In the end, it is the blind leading the blind.
String.Dest: The agent turns a blind eye to morality. His tool turns a blind eye to the agent's true intentions. In the end, it is the blind leading the blind.

String.Source: Tell me a tale from Cyrodiil.
String.Dest: 给我讲一个赛瑞迪尔的故事吧。

String.Source: Certainly. For a fortnight I had stayed outside the halls of Skingrad, in hopes of obtaining an audience with the Count.
String.Dest: 当然可以。就为了能找到个能跟宫廷搭上边的听众，我可是在斯金格勒的宫殿外呆过两周呢。

String.Source: Tell me a tale from Cyrodiil.
String.Dest: 给我讲一个赛瑞迪尔的故事吧。

String.Source: After many attempts I decided to head west on the Gold Road to Kvatch, passing through the tomato fields that quilted the land outside the gate.
String.Dest: 尝试多次之后我决定走黄金大道向西前往科瓦奇城，路过城门外大片的番茄农场。

String.Source: Tell me a tale from Cyrodiil.
String.Dest: 给我讲一个赛瑞迪尔的故事吧。

String.Source: It was then that my eyes set upon a frail old man, weeping at the base of a tree.
String.Dest: 然后我注意到一个瘦弱的老头，坐在一棵大树下哭泣。

String.Source: Tell me a tale from Cyrodiil.
String.Dest: 给我讲一个赛瑞迪尔的故事吧。

String.Source: He had lost his sister to vampirism, and had walked all of Cyrodiil retrieving the ingredients for the cure. Yet it came at a terrible cost.
String.Dest: 他失去了不幸染上了吸血热姐姐,又曾为了治愈她跋涉全泰姆瑞尔遍求药材。因此耗费了巨大的财力人力。

String.Source: Tell me a tale from Cyrodiil.
String.Dest: 给我讲一个赛瑞迪尔的故事吧。

String.Source: From life came death, and from hope bloomed sorrow. She died less than ten days after she was cured.
String.Dest: 从生到死，从希望之中绽放悲伤。在他痊愈后不到十天，她就死去了。

String.Source: Tell me a tale from Cyrodiil.
String.Dest: 给我讲一个赛瑞迪尔的故事吧。

String.Source: For vampirism was the cure for time, and time is deadliest disease of all.
String.Dest: 因为吸血热病原是治疗时间的解药，时间本身才是史上最致命的疾病啊。

String.Source: I met an old Penitus Oculatus agent who mentioned it.
String.Dest: 我遇到了那个谁提到过的锐眼鹰使者。

String.Source: A member of the Emperor's personal guard? Oh my, you do have an eclectic circle of friends. I hope that I may someday count myself among them.
String.Dest: A member of the Emperor's personal guard? Oh my, you do have an eclectic circle of friends. I hope that I may someday count myself among them.

String.Source: I met an old Penitus Oculatus agent who mentioned it.
String.Dest: 我遇到了那个谁提到过的锐眼鹰使者。

String.Source: This humble bard will do well to include herself among them.
String.Dest: 我这谦逊老实的吟游诗人一定能和他们相处融洽的。

String.Source: Why not perform in Markarth?
String.Dest: 为什么不去马卡斯城表演？

String.Source: Bards are quite territorial, and there are many in Markarth who already call the Silver-Blood Inn their home.
String.Dest: 吟游诗人有着明确的地盘儿。很多在马卡斯城的吟游诗人已经把银血旅店称为他们的家了。

String.Source: Why not perform in Markarth?
String.Dest: 为什么不去马卡斯城表演？

String.Source: In Old Hroldan, I can ply my trade without having to contend for the floor. There's also the advantage of novelty.
String.Dest: 在这老霍尔丹，我能安心卖艺不用为抢地盘操心。而且对这门手艺还有些额外的好处。

String.Source: Why not perform in Markarth?
String.Dest: 为什么不去马卡斯城表演？

String.Source: Just as a meal is most delicious when one's hunger is at its peak, the emotion of a song is best felt by those with virgin ears.
String.Dest: 一餐饭的味道对饥饿到极点的人是最棒的，一首歌的感情也只有在未经熏染的耳朵里才最美妙。

String.Source: Why not perform in Markarth?
String.Dest: 为什么不去马卡斯城表演？

String.Source: Although I must confess, I do like the atmosphere of a traditional Nord inn.
String.Dest: 不过我必须承认，我也喜欢传统的诺德酒馆儿的气氛。

String.Source: Why not perform in Markarth?
String.Dest: 为什么不去马卡斯城表演？

String.Source: I love warm beds and homely smells...and also jewels, although I suppose one of those three has nothing to do with Old Hroldan.
String.Dest: 我喜欢温暖的床和平凡的味道……也喜欢珠宝，不过我感觉这三样儿跟古赫洛登都没啥关系。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: You're persistent and clever. I like that. Alright, clever girl, I will say this, and nothing more.
String.Dest: 你真是倔强得很聪明呢。我喜欢。好吧聪明女，我就把这个说给你听吧，多的可没有。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: There once was a loyal and dedicated soldier who held beside him a great, big shield.
String.Dest: 曾经有一位英勇尽职的战士守卫在他身侧手持一面巨盾。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: For king and country he raised it high, shielding himself from arrow and sword.
String.Dest: 为了国家和君主他将它高举，使他免于刀箭之虞。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: And when his king razed the land and raped its people, he used it to shield his eyes.
String.Dest: 而当他的君主践踏着江山，掠夺着人民之时，他却用那巨盾遮住自己的眼睛。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: You're persistent and clever. I like that. Alright, clever boy, I will say this, and nothing more.
String.Dest: 你真是倔强得很聪明呢。我喜欢。好吧聪明鬼，我就把这个说给你听吧，多的可没有。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: There once was a loyal and dedicated soldier who held beside him a great, big shield.
String.Dest: 曾经有一位英勇尽职的战士守卫在他身侧手持一面巨盾。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: For king and country he raised it high, shielding himself from arrow and sword.
String.Dest: 为了国家和君主他将它高举，使他免于刀箭之虞。

String.Source: Easy. By eagerly embracing the role you make yourself an imposter.
String.Dest: 很简单。因为那个热切拥抱的作用，你让自己成了一个骗子。

String.Source: And when his king razed the land and raped its people, he used it to shield his eyes.
String.Dest: 而当他的君主践踏着江山，掠夺着人民之时，他却用那巨盾遮住自己的眼睛。

String.Source: The song of the day. "Ragnar the Red."
String.Dest: 今日推荐曲目："红衣拉格纳."

String.Source: An excellent request. A bloody song, but one the locals favor.
String.Dest: 真是一个极好的要求。一首血淋淋的歌，但是当地人喜欢它。

String.Source: Education through experience. I follow a similar philosophy.
String.Dest: 教育来自经验。我遵循了一个类似的理念。

String.Source: They say there are many roads to wisdom, but not all of them are interesting.
String.Dest: 他说通往智慧的道路有很多条，但是并不是每条走起来都有趣。

String.Source: So you attract intrigue but keep the crowd at a distance.
String.Dest: 你引起别人的好奇但不让任何人了解详情。

String.Source: Why yes. Besides if I were truly the Raven of Anvil, why play the song? Why not cover my hair with a cloth?
String.Dest: Why yes. Besides if I were truly the Raven of Anvil, why play the song? Why not cover my hair with a cloth?

String.Source: I've found a forger to put your name on the journal.
String.Dest: 我已经找到人把你的名字弄上名册了。

String.Source: Fantastic. I trust you know what needs to be done next. Let's keep our distance until the job is complete.
String.Dest: 很好，我相信你知道下一步该做什么。让我们在活儿做完之前保持点距离吧。

String.Source: I want to hear the "Age of Oppression."
String.Dest: 我想听到“时代的压迫。”

String.Source: A good request.
String.Dest: 这是个不错的要求。

String.Source: Tell me a story from Hammerfell.
String.Dest: 给我讲个 落锤省的故事吧。

String.Source: As you wish. It was naught but a season ago, before I came to Skyrim, in the city of Elinhir.
String.Dest: 好吧。那大概是三个月以前，那个时候我还没来天际省，在爱林希尔。

String.Source: Tell me a story from Hammerfell.
String.Dest: 给我讲个 落锤省的故事吧。

String.Source: There I met a couple, hiding out in an old shack tucked between a canopy of trees. Two women who fought on the field and fell for each other.
String.Dest: There I met a couple, hiding out in an old shack tucked between a canopy of trees. Two women who fought on the field and fell for each other.

String.Source: Tell me a story from Hammerfell.
String.Dest: 给我讲个 落锤省的故事吧。

String.Source: A Thalmor Justicar and an Alik'r warrior. They knew their lives were short. They knew their story would end in tragedy.
String.Dest: 一个是梭默审判者一个是阿利克尔战士。她们知道自己生命短暂。也知道她们的故事将以悲剧告终。

String.Source: Tell me a story from Hammerfell.
String.Dest: 给我讲个 落锤省的故事吧。

String.Source: So they asked me to tell their tale, so that it wouldn't be forgotten.
String.Dest: 所以他们要我告诉他们的故事，这样它就不会忘记了。

String.Source: Tell me a story from Hammerfell.
String.Dest: 给我讲个 落锤省的故事吧。

String.Source: It's not fairy tale by any means. Nor is their love the kind that we can easily digest.
String.Dest: 这当然不可能是什么美丽童话，也不是种很好理解的爱情。

String.Source: Tell me a story from Hammerfell.
String.Dest: 给我讲个 落锤省的故事吧。

String.Source: They betrayed their homes, their kings, and their Gods, so that they could stay true to their hearts.
String.Dest: 他们背叛了他们的家园，他们的王，以及他们的神，然而就因为如此，他们才能坦率地去面对自己的内心。

String.Source: What was it?
String.Dest: 那是啥?

String.Source: A serpentine figure half a league in length, black as the void with scales that glistened like a soul gem, hunting a flock of whales.
String.Dest: 一只上千米长的蛇形怪物，虚空般漆黑的身体上覆盖着灵魂石一样闪耀的鳞片，在猎杀一群鲸鱼。

String.Source: What was it?
String.Dest: 那是啥?

String.Source: The captain wasted no time turning the galleon around. Behind us, the ocean bubbled with venom as it sunk its fangs into its prey.
String.Dest: 船长争分夺秒的把帆船调了个方向。在我们身后 ，海洋泛起剧毒的气泡 ，就像将它的毒牙刺入猎物之中。

String.Source: What was it?
String.Dest: 那是啥?

String.Source: Some say it was a water dragon. Others contend it was a kraken. And some will say it wasn't wine we drank, but skooma.
String.Dest: 有些人说这是条水龙。另一些人认为它是一个海怪。有些人会说这不是我们喝的酒，而是斯库玛。

String.Source: Tell me a story from High Rock.
String.Dest: 跟我说说高岩省的故事。

String.Source: Of course. It all began when I joined a group of troubadours who traveled from port to port across Illiac Bay.
String.Dest: 当然。当我加入了那群游遍伊利亚克湾的吟游诗人们之后这一切就开始了。

String.Source: Tell me a story from High Rock.
String.Dest: 跟我说说高岩省的故事。

String.Source: We aimed to sail from the docks of Menevia all the way to Betony, the tiny island that serves as the period to High Rock's western peninsula.
String.Dest: 我们准备从Menevia的港口出发一路到Betony，那个附属于高岩西部半岛的小岛。

String.Source: Tell me a story from High Rock.
String.Dest: 跟我说说高岩省的故事。

String.Source: Three days into our journey and our spirits were high, and our bodies drunk in wine and cheer. It all changed on the fourth.
String.Dest: 前三天我们精神抖索，跋山涉水，我们还喝酒庆祝。 第四天，一切都变了。

String.Source: Tell me a story from High Rock.
String.Dest: 跟我说说高岩省的故事。

String.Source: It was the 18th of Morning Star, that ancient day when the spirits wake from their wintry slumber, as they have for centuries since time began.
String.Dest: 这是晨星月的第18日。这个古老的节日是灵魂从冬日的安眠中苏醒的日子。它从几个世纪前就开始产生了。

String.Source: Tell me a story from High Rock.
String.Dest: 跟我说说高岩省的故事。

String.Source: Only what rose from the seas that day was no spirit.
String.Dest: 只是从海上运来的玫瑰花那天蔫儿了吧唧的。

String.Source: What is "Dusk on Anvil Harbor" really about?
String.Dest: "暮色铁砧港 "实际上是什么？

String.Source: It began as a song of goodbyes, and so it ended. The first was written by a wife whose soldier husband left for war.
String.Dest: It began as a song of goodbyes, and so it ended. The first was written by a wife whose soldier husband left for war.

String.Source: What is "Dusk on Anvil Harbor" really about?
String.Dest: "暮色铁砧港 "实际上是什么？

String.Source: The second goodbye was that of a widowed husband, one who chose his rulers over the Gods.
String.Dest: 第二次离别是一个失去了妻子的丈夫，为了维护统治者而放弃了诸神的人。

String.Source: What is "Dusk on Anvil Harbor" really about?
String.Dest: "暮色铁砧港 "实际上是什么？

String.Source: The third belongs to their daughter, who mourns the life of her mother, and the death of her innocence.
String.Dest: The third belongs to their daughter, who mourns the life of her mother, and the death of her innocence.

String.Source: Clouds sweep over the skies; And floods the swamps of my eyes; Rain falls on Black Marsh year after year; But the Hist sheds not a tear;
String.Dest: 【歌】流云扫过天空，盖住了我的眼睛；大雨年复一年地落在黑沼省的土地上，但是希斯特从未流过一滴泪。

String.Source: Forests of green slowly fade, in mists like ghosts of the day; Storms rage through Black Marsh year after year, but the Hist sheds not a tear;
String.Dest: 绿之森林缓缓蔓延，模糊如同白日之鬼；风雪一年一年怒吼着穿过黑沼省，但是寒风穿破洞的嘘声不是哭泣。

String.Source: Death comes to all we hold dear, but for the Hist shed not a tear.
String.Dest: 【歌】我们珍视的一切在死神面前似乎无法避免，但我们流下的不仅是唏嘘的眼泪。

String.Source: {Intro}
String.Dest: {介绍}

String.Source: The Wolf strode upon great Jorrvaskr, to meet the sons of Ysgramor; They said what are you but a harbinger, to leave us hopeless and forlorn;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】这条狼大步踏入伟大的月瓦斯卡，去寻找伊斯格拉谟之子；他们说，你就是一个把我们弃于绝望与无助的预言者。

String.Source: The Wolf bore its fangs and spread its claws, and tore at its own hide; Drink the blood, and become my sons, or by dawn you'll not survive;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】那匹狼张开利爪亮出獠牙，然后撕下了它自己的皮；喝下这血，成为我的孩子吧。否则黎明到来之时你就命不长。

String.Source: And so the pack was born again as the Wolves of Jorrvaskr; To rule in life and serve in death, as the moonlight bound hunter.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】重生时已是月瓦斯卡之群狼。身为生者却宛若行尸走肉，化为与月光永伴的猎手。

String.Source: And so the pack was born again as the Wolves of Jorrvaskr; To rule in life and serve in death, as the moonlight's dark hunter.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】重生时已是月瓦斯卡之群狼。身为生者却宛若行尸走肉，化为与月光永伴的猎手。

String.Source: I knew meself a maiden fair, with em'rald eyes and fire-red hair! She owned a tavern by the sea, and served warm drinks of mellow honey!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】少女如花正美貌，赤发碧眼秋波长！海边开家小酒馆儿，蜜酒下肚口芬香！

String.Source: Drink ye merry, drink ye thirsty, bring thy crew 'n revel freely! For on one thing we're all agreed, that Mogo made the finest mead!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】喝个痛快，喝个大饱，让你的船员们自由狂欢吧！我们一致认为，莫戈的蜂蜜酒天下无双！

String.Source: Mogo's mead, Mogo's mead, the only drink we'd e'er need! Take a flask and take a seat, and drink thyself a sweety-treat!
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】莫戈莫戈的蜂蜜酒，莫戈莫戈的蜂蜜酒，人只要这酒就够！找个座来拿一瓶，醍醐灌顶百病走！

String.Source: {Lute - Tale of the Tongues}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴——《龙吼传奇》

String.Source: {Lute - Tale of the Tongues}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴——《龙吼传奇》

String.Source: {Drum - Medley}
String.Dest: {鼓声 - 混奏}

String.Source: {Lute - Dragonborn Comes}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴——《龙裔来了》}

String.Source: {Lute - Medley}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴混奏}

String.Source: {Lute - Medley}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴混奏}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Flute - Medley}
String.Dest: {长笛- 集成曲}

String.Source: {Lute - The Journey}
String.Dest: {Lute - The Journey}

String.Source: {Lute - Portraiture}
String.Dest: {Lute - Portraiture}

String.Source: {Lute - Portraiture}
String.Dest: {Lute - Portraiture}

String.Source: Our hero, our hero, claims a warrior's heart! I tell you, I tell you, the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】英雄，英雄，勇者无惧。我告诉你，我告诉你，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: With a Voice wielding power of the ancient Nord art; Believe, believe the Dragornborn comes;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】诺德技艺，龙吼回归。没错，没错，他是龙裔。

String.Source: It's an end to the evil, of all Skyrim's foes; Beware, beware the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 终结邪恶，敌人的末日。当心，当心，龙裔出世。

String.Source: For the darkness has passed and the legend yet grows; You'll know, you'll know the Dragonborn comes.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】黑暗消逝，传奇之曲正在编织。你会发现，你会发现，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: Oh, there once was a hero named Ragnar the Red, who came riding to Whiterun from ole Rorikstead!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】哦，曾经有位名叫“红衣拉格纳”的英雄，他从美丽的洛利克镇一路骑马来到白漫城！

String.Source: And the braggart did swagger and brandish his blade, as he told of bold battles and gold he had made!
String.Dest: 大话精吹嘘他身经百战，炫耀着金币还有他的剑。

String.Source: But then he went quiet, did Ragnar the Red, when he met the shield-maiden Matilda who said;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】红衣拉格纳后来变了哑巴，全因他遇到盾牌女仆玛提尔达，她说……

String.Source: Oh, you talk and you lie and you drink all our mead! Now I think it's high time that you lie down and bleed!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】噢，你吹牛喝酒耍活宝！真有种就不要跑！

String.Source: And so then came the clashing and slashing of steel, as the brave lass Matilda charged in full of zeal!
String.Dest: 一阵金属碰撞叮叮当当，勇敢的女孩玛提尔达战意高涨！

String.Source: And the braggart named Ragnar was boastful no more! When his ugly red head rolled around on the floor!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】自大狂拉格纳再也没法在那吹牛了！因为他那丑陋的红毛脑袋掉在地上摔成了一堆渣！

String.Source: Waves touch the coast, harbored in twilight's blue; From dawn came the sunlight, and with dusk it fades from our view;
String.Dest: 浪花爱抚沙滩，心却怀着黄昏的忧伤；破晓携来阳光，黄昏渐渐隐没于天边；

String.Source: Calm embraces the sky, while storms rage in our hearts; For honor, glory, and love, from Anvil we do depart;
String.Dest: 平静拥抱着天空，然而风暴却在我们心中怒吼；为了尊严，荣誉和挚爱，我们离开了自己的铁砧。

String.Source: The fire lights the path, and the salt, it sprays in our eyes; But warriors born of stone, they are never afraid to die;
String.Dest: 【歌】火耀前路，盐刺双瞳。勇士如磐，悍不畏死。

String.Source: Bells on the docks, they cry out for the mortal day; And winds sing the dirge, for words we never could say;
String.Dest: 码头的钟声，因那终将逝去的日子而泣。微风轻吟挽歌，诉说着我们永不能言的话语。

String.Source: And sails fly at half mast, in the color of evening's hue; And tears break the silence, for the children we almost knew;
String.Dest: 【歌】帆船降下了半旗，与夜色相溶。泪水滑落的声音打破了寂静，我们都知道对这孩子来说意味着什么。

String.Source: When dawn kissed the ocean, from the golden light came our birth; And when dusk falls on the harbor, to the golden shores we will return.
String.Dest: When dawn kissed the ocean, from the golden light came our birth; And when dusk falls on the harbor, to the golden shores we will return.

String.Source: We drink to our youth, and to days come and gone. For the age of oppression is now nearly done.
String.Dest: 为我们的年少举酒，为过去和到来的日子干杯。为压迫的年代将要成为过往的旧岁。

String.Source: We drink to our youth, and to days come and gone. For the age of oppression is now nearly done.
String.Dest: 为了我们的青春，为了那些逝去的和将来的日子，我们干杯。

String.Source: We'll drive out the Empire from this land that we own. With our blood and our steel we will take back our home.
String.Dest: 驱逐帝国找回自我，用鲜血和盔甲重建家国。

String.Source: All hail to Ulfric! You are the High King! In your great honor we drink and we sing.
String.Dest: 向乌弗瑞克欢呼！您是至高王！我们为你的荣耀举杯欢庆。

String.Source: We're the children of Skyrim, and we fight all our lives. And when Sovngarde beckons, every one of us dies!
String.Dest: 我们是天际的子民，我们一辈子都在战斗，只要松加德传来召唤，我们就英勇赴义。

String.Source: But this land is ours and we'll see it wiped clean. Of the scourge that has sullied our hopes and our dreams.
String.Dest: 这片大地是我们的，洁白而干净。任何灾难只会加强我们的信念跟梦想！

String.Source: This is for all the Sons and Daughters of Skyrim, who gave their lives for freedom.
String.Dest: 这是为所有天际省的儿女们, 他们为自由献出了自己的生命。

String.Source: Alduin's wings they did darken the sky; His roar fury's fire and his scales sharpened scythes;
String.Dest: 奥杜因其翼遮天蔽日，其吼怒焰四溢，其鳞利如刀锋。

String.Source: Men ran and they cowered and they fought and they died; They burned and they bled as they issued their cries;
String.Dest: 人类退缩、逃跑，战斗、死亡。人类受伤、流血，痛哭、哀嚎。

String.Source: We need saviors to free us from Alduin's rage; Heroes on the field of this new war to wage;
String.Dest: 我们需要救世主将我们从奥杜因的愤怒中解放。这片大地上的英雄们要踏入新的战场上。

String.Source: And if Alduin wins, men is gone from this world; Lost in the shadows of the black wings unfurled;
String.Dest: 奥杜因的胜利，将带来人类的灭亡，黑色双翼的阴影下无处可藏。

String.Source: But then came the Tongues on that terrible day; Steadfast as winter they entered the fray;
String.Dest: 可怕的岁月里，发声者们加入战斗，踏着坚定的步伐，凯歌高奏。

String.Source: And all heard the music of Alduin's doom; The sweet song of Skyrim, sky-shattering Thu'um;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】奥杜因拉下了的命运之幕，那是天际的赞歌，是响彻天际的吐目。

String.Source: And so the Tongues freed us from Alduin's rage; Gave the gift of the Voice, ushered in a new age;
String.Dest: 发声者从奥杜因的愤怒之中解救了我们，龙吼的天赐，引领我们进入新的时代。

String.Source: If Alduin's eternal then eternity's done; For his story is over and the dragons are gone.
String.Dest: 奥杜因的永恒，已然不在。奥杜因的故事，已经终结。龙也消失于天外。

String.Source: To the Dragonborn, the savior of Skyrim!
String.Dest: 致敬龙裔，天际的救世主！

String.Source: All right, then.
String.Dest: 那就这样吧。

String.Source: Farewell.
String.Dest: 再会。

String.Source: Until next time.
String.Dest: 下回见。

String.Source: Greetings.
String.Dest: 你好。

String.Source: How can I help you?
String.Dest: 有什么我能效劳的？

String.Source: Well met, sera.
String.Dest: Well met, sera.

String.Source: {Bard Play}
String.Dest: {吟游诗人演奏}

String.Source: Not many people can find the place, to be honest, since it's not on any map.
String.Dest: 说实话，没多少人能找到这个地方。因为那里在任何一份地图上都没有标示。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: The only reason the guard were able to arrest my father is because he was forced to spend the night in Solitude.
String.Dest: 守卫逮捕我父亲唯一可行的理由就是他非自愿而不得不在独孤城过了一夜。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: It will be my pleasure, sera.
String.Dest: 这是我的荣幸，大人。

String.Source: Portraiture. I'll play the lute.
String.Dest: 接下来我会用鲁特琴为大家演奏《肖像》这首曲子。

String.Source: (Bard) Portraiture. I'll play the lute.
String.Dest: (吟游诗人)描述，我会用鲁特琴弹奏。

String.Source: Ah, a fine request. I would be honored to sing this for you.
String.Dest: 啊，选得不错。很荣幸为您演唱这首歌。

String.Source: (Bard) Eyldi the Bear. If you sing, I can play the lute.
String.Dest: (Bard) Eyldi the Bear。你唱歌，我弹琴好吧？

String.Source: Naturally, and I'm sure the question has crossed your mind as well. Exactly what does this fetcher...
String.Dest: 很自然，而且我确信这个疑问也在你脑海中出现过。

String.Source: So your plan is to rob the Jarl?
String.Dest: 所以说你的计划是抢劫领主？

String.Source: Fuck! Stop texting me.
String.Dest: 法克！别他妈再烦我了。

String.Source: So your plan is to rob the Jarl?
String.Dest: 所以说你的计划是抢劫领主？

String.Source: Sorry, but that's not something I care to say. I never make friends, and I rarely work with the same person twice. So for us, this is it.
String.Dest: 抱歉，但是我并不关心这事。我从来不交朋友, 而且我一般也不跟同一个人合作两次。所以对咱俩来讲，事情就是这样。

String.Source: Where are you headed now?
String.Dest: 你现在要前往何处?

String.Source: You greedy little fetcher. Fine, here's your gold. And if we never see each other again, it'll be too soon.
String.Dest: 你这个贪婪的取物人。 罢了, 这是你的金子。 再者万一我们以后无法再见, 至少一时半会不会了。

String.Source: You still owe me 300 gold. The safe contents weren't part of the deal.
String.Dest: 你还欠我300金币。安全可不是协议的一部分。

String.Source: That's what I want them to think. If they train their eyes on my father, they'll never see the real mole reaching into their pockets.
String.Dest: 那是我让他们这么以为的。只要他们的眼睛盯着我父亲，就永远看不到真正在掏他们口袋的是谁了。

String.Source: By the way, the safe also had a letter. It said your father was helping you.
String.Dest: 对了，那个保险箱里还有一封信，上面说你的父亲当时也在帮你。

String.Source: But if they do wise up, there will always be someone else I can use, just as I used you.
String.Dest: But if they do wise up, there will always be someone else I can use, just as I used you.

String.Source: By the way, the safe also had a letter. It said your father was helping you.
String.Dest: 对了，那个保险箱里还有一封信，上面说你的父亲当时也在帮你。

String.Source: Now, if you'll excuse me, sera, I must take my leave.
String.Dest: 现在，如果你不介意的话，先生，我必须得走了。

String.Source: By the way, the safe also had a letter. It said your father was helping you.
String.Dest: 对了，那个保险箱里还有一封信，上面说你的父亲当时也在帮你。

String.Source: And it was a pleasure doing business with you, sera, for a bard often recites the tales, but rarely does she get to live them.
String.Dest: 跟您做事真的很开心，先生，虽然我们诗人咏唱美丽的故事，可很少有机会亲身演绎它。

String.Source: It was a pleasure doing business with you, Ofelia.
String.Dest: 奥梵拉，能和您做生意真的很令人愉快。

String.Source: Now then, if we're all settled, I'll be seeing you.
String.Dest: 好了，等我们全部搞定了以后，我们再碰面吧。

String.Source: It was a pleasure doing business with you, Ofelia.
String.Dest: 奥梵拉，能和您做生意真的很令人愉快。

String.Source: You did good, I'll give you that much. Real professional. But this was a one time thing. When you work with me, it always is.
String.Dest: 你做的很好。我绝对承认。真是非常专业。不过这只能是一锤子买卖。只要是跟我合作，都是这样。

String.Source: We work well together. We should make this a thing.
String.Dest: 合作愉快，看来我们能干成。

String.Source: I don't want to hear your excuses now. You turned that keep into a bloodbath. Lucky for me no one's ever going to remember I was there.
String.Dest: 我现在没兴趣听你的借口。你血洗了整个城堡。幸好不会人记得我在那出现过。

String.Source: Sorry about that. I had some issues with the lock.
String.Dest: 我对此很抱歉，对于那把锁我有些话想说。

String.Source: You'd best do the same. This is where we part ways.
String.Dest: 你最好也做得到。我们就此别过了。

String.Source: Sorry about that. I had some issues with the lock.
String.Dest: 我对此很抱歉，对于那把锁我有些话想说。

String.Source: Maybe. Although I wouldn't expect you to. I may rely on others from time to time, but that doesn't mean I trust them.
String.Dest: Maybe. Although I wouldn't expect you to. I may rely on others from time to time, but that doesn't mean I trust them.

String.Source: I thought you may have forgotten it. Don't worry, I would've burned it.
String.Dest: 我觉得你可能忘了它。别担心，我不会烧了它的。

String.Source: If I were you, I wouldn't trust me either. So with that, this is where we part ways.
String.Dest: 嗯，就算我是你，我也不会相信我自己。既然如此，咱们还是分手吧。

String.Source: I thought you may have forgotten it. Don't worry, I would've burned it.
String.Dest: 我觉得你可能忘了它。别担心，我不会烧了它的。

String.Source: Save the charm for milk-drinkers. This was a business arrangement. A very profitable one, I hope.
String.Dest: 给那些小屁孩瞧瞧你最大的魅力吧。这是个严肃的安排。能赚很大一笔钱。希望如此。

String.Source: Admit it. You wanted to see me too.
String.Dest: 别装了，你也想见我。

String.Source: I'll be taking that, thank you very much. Didn't think I'd leave without getting that back, did you?
String.Dest: 我会来拿的，十分感谢你。你知道我不拿回东西就不会走人的，是吧？

String.Source: I'll be taking that, thank you very much. Have to keep a low profile, after you butchered all those mercs. Damn unprofessional, is what that was.
String.Dest: 我会拿下的，真是多谢你。有你杀了那些佣兵之后，现在我只得保持低调。该死的菜鸟们，就会添乱。

String.Source: Oh well, what's done is done. That blood's on your hands, not mine. I'm just glad I got what I came for.
String.Dest: 唉算了，生米已成熟饭。反正沾血的是你的手，不是我就好。我要的东西得到了就够满意的了。

String.Source: Oh, there once was a hero named Ragnar the Red, who came riding to Whiterun from ole Rorikstead!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】哦，曾经有位名叫“红衣拉格纳”的英雄，他从美丽的洛利克镇一路骑马来到白漫城！

String.Source: And the braggart did swagger and brandish his blade, as he told of bold battles and gold he had made!
String.Dest: 大话精吹嘘他身经百战，炫耀着金币还有他的剑。

String.Source: But then he went quiet, did Ragnar the Red, when he met the shield-maiden Matilda who said;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】红衣拉格纳后来变了哑巴，全因他遇到盾牌女仆玛提尔达，她说……

String.Source: Oh, you talk and you lie and you drink all our mead! Now I think it's high time that you lie down and bleed!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】噢，你吹牛喝酒耍活宝！真有种就不要跑！

String.Source: And so then came the clashing and slashing of steel, as the brave lass Matilda charged in full of zeal!
String.Dest: 一阵金属碰撞叮叮当当，勇敢的女孩玛提尔达战意高涨！

String.Source: And the braggart named Ragnar was boastful no more! When his ugly red head rolled around on the floor!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】自大狂拉格纳再也没法在那吹牛了！因为他那丑陋的红毛脑袋掉在地上摔成了一堆渣！

String.Source: {Finish}
String.Dest: {完成}

String.Source: {Departs}
String.Dest: {离开 }

String.Source: I thank you once more. Long live the Jarl! All hail the City of Stone!
String.Dest: 我要再次感谢你。领主万岁！向巨石之城致敬！

String.Source: Waves touch the coast, harbored in twilight's blue; From dawn came the sunlight, and with dusk it fades from our view;
String.Dest: 浪花爱抚沙滩，心却怀着黄昏的忧伤；破晓携来阳光，黄昏渐渐隐没于天边；

String.Source: Calm embraces the sky, while storms rage in our hearts; For honor, glory, and love, from Anvil we do depart;
String.Dest: 平静拥抱着天空，然而风暴却在我们心中怒吼；为了尊严，荣誉和挚爱，我们离开了自己的铁砧。

String.Source: The fire lights the path, and the salt, it sprays in our eyes; But warriors born of stone, they are never afraid to die;
String.Dest: 【歌】火耀前路，盐刺双瞳。勇士如磐，悍不畏死。

String.Source: Bells on the docks, they cry out for the mortal day; And winds sing the dirge, for words we never could say;
String.Dest: 码头的钟声，因那终将逝去的日子而泣。微风轻吟挽歌，诉说着我们永不能言的话语。

String.Source: And sails fly at half mast, in the color of evening's hue; And tears break the silence, for the children we almost knew;
String.Dest: 【歌】帆船降下了半旗，与夜色相溶。泪水滑落的声音打破了寂静，我们都知道对这孩子来说意味着什么。

String.Source: When dawn kissed the ocean, from the golden light came our birth; And when dusk falls on the harbor, to the golden shores we will return.
String.Dest: When dawn kissed the ocean, from the golden light came our birth; And when dusk falls on the harbor, to the golden shores we will return.

String.Source: {Finish}
String.Dest: {完成}

String.Source: Alas, it is with great regret that I inform you that my next song will be my last.
String.Dest: 唉，我不得不告诉你我写的的下一首歌将是我的最后一首歌。

String.Source: Nobles, Thanes, Housecarls, and of course, my Jarl. To be allowed to play here today has been an honor that mere words cannot express.
String.Dest: 贵族们，男爵们，侍卫们，当然还有，我的领主！今天能在这里演奏是我的无上光荣！

String.Source: I hope that this final song will properly convey my gratitude, for they say music is a language that transcends borders, politics, and station.
String.Dest: 我希望这最后一首歌可以完满表达我的谢意，人们不是常说，音乐是一种超脱一切的语言吗，它跨越国界，无关政治，没有尊卑。

String.Source: Thus I bring you this dirge from my birth home in Cyrodiil. A city near the Gold Coast by the name of Anvil.
String.Dest: 因此我为您带来的这首哀歌是来自故乡赛洛迪尔。一座位于黄金海岸附近名为铁砧的城市。

String.Source: And just as the first anvils were made of stone, so is the City of Markarth. Thus, our cities are bound together, in hardship, sadness, and strife.
String.Dest: 正如最早的铁毡是由石头所造，马卡斯城也是由石头所筑。因而，我们的城市是被艰苦、哀伤与冲突紧密捆绑在一起的。

String.Source: And so, I present to you, "Dusk on Anvil Harbor."
String.Dest: 在此，我将您演奏“暮色铁砧港”。

String.Source: I thank you for your applause. Please, I am not deserving of such praise.
String.Dest: 感谢你的掌声，我真高兴，其实我不值得如此赞美的。

String.Source: I knew meself a maiden fair, with em'rald eyes and fire-red hair! She owned a tavern by the sea, and served warm drinks of mellow honey!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】少女如花正美貌，赤发碧眼秋波长！海边开家小酒馆儿，蜜酒下肚口芬香！

String.Source: Drink ye merry, drink ye thirsty, bring thy crew 'n revel freely! For on one thing we're all agreed, that Mogo made the finest mead!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】喝个痛快，喝个大饱，让你的船员们自由狂欢吧！我们一致认为，莫戈的蜂蜜酒天下无双！

String.Source: Mogo's mead, Mogo's mead, the only drink we'd e'er need! Take a flask and take a seat, and drink thyself a sweety-treat!
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】莫戈莫戈的蜂蜜酒，莫戈莫戈的蜂蜜酒，人只要这酒就够！找个座来拿一瓶，醍醐灌顶百病走！

String.Source: {Finish}
String.Dest: {完成}

String.Source: You words do me honor, my Jarl, I will do my best not to betray them.
String.Dest: 多谢盛赞，领主大人。我会尽我所能不负厚望。

String.Source: For my next song, I will play a tavern favorite, Mogo's Mead. A song the commoners love, but even a Jarl can appreciate.
String.Dest: 下一首歌，我要演奏酒馆经典：《莫戈的蜂蜜酒》。一首深受百姓喜爱，连领主大人也欣赏的曲子。
